reviews.review_msg: A wonderfully entertaining speaker, but abnormally cruel in the workload/marking department.  Extremely difficult in the marking department, and prone to drastic mood swings.  Don't take her class unless you would like to do more work than you've ever done in your undergrad life, and receive middling grades for doing it.

I went back to school as a mature student, originally planning to major in History. Anne was my favourite prof and one of the main reasons I switched to English. She is endlessly engaging and passionate, with a truly wide-ranging intellect. If you are interested in broadening your horizons as opposed to simply getting a credit, you can't do better.
By a long shot, the single most understanding prof I've ever come across.  She cares about students more than any I've ever seen.  That is her best quality--worth taking on that account.

Anne is charismatic, original, enthusiastic, and sweet. Her lectures and seminars are fab. Best English prof yet at SFU. Just the right amount of reading and course work. Will definately take any course she offers in the future.

This man sweats ego.  That said, I was astounded by both the analytical genius and entertainment value of his lectures.  On a shallow note, he's not as hot up close as he is when seen from the back row of a 300-seat lecture hall.
One of the best professors I've had the privledge of studying under.  Intelligent but very down to earth and makes every class engaging, fun, and informative.  Rock on Budra!!
Great fun to attend his lectures, knows his stuff inside and out and knows how to make it interesting. Best English course I've taken at SFU.
Budra was the best English teacher I've had at my 4 years at SFU.  So interesting and engaging and actually made me want to go to class (that's a new one for me).  Definitely take a class with him!
